person.persName: Green Clay (Madison County, Kentucky, farmer, secretary of legation, and major (U.S.A))

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer, secretary of legation, and major (U.S.A). Lexington, Kentucky, native. Son of Cassius Marcellus Clay and Mary Jane Clay. Signed a marriage bone to Cornelia "Cornie" Walker Clay in Madison County, Kentucky, on October 8, 1861. Graduate of Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut, in 1858. Resident in Lexington in 1840. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Lexington in 1840. Attended school in Madison County in 1850. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Secretary of Legation to Cassius Marcellus Clay in 1861. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as major from November 26, 1861, to January 11, 1862.
